docs.snippet: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 12 -- Before the United States Supreme Court once more is the perennial case of Caryl Chessman, California convict-author, who is in the twelfth year of his residence in San Quentin's "death row."

docs.abstract: Chessman has been in San Quentin 'death row' 12 yrs; case revd; worldwide interest noted

headline.main: THE CHESSMAN CASE: A COURT PERENNIAL; Years of Appeals From 'Death Row' Have Stirred Worldwide Interest

docs.snippet: A RECENT bargain of an air tour took my wife and me into eight of the ten South American republics in forty-five days. We had enough leisure to look around and take side trips in the below-the-Equator springtime, thus including a wide variety of...
docs.lead_paragraph: A RECENT bargain of an air tour took my wife and me into eight of the ten South American republics in forty-five days. We had enough leisure to look around and take side trips in the below-the-Equator springtime, thus including a wide variety of sights, color and excitement.
docs.abstract: article on 45-day bargain tour of 8 S Amer countries; illus

headline.main: DISCOUNT AIR TOUR; Trip Around South America Covers Variety of Sights in 45 Days

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 -- Ecuador, which was to have been host to the eleventh Inter-American Conference at Quito Feb. 1, asked today that the conference be indefinitely postponed.

docs.snippet: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 23 (UPI) -- Six sacks of large, coat-length pelts -- including Persian lamb and Russian sable -- dropped from the sky yesterday onto Alhambra, San Marino and San Gabriel.

headline.main: Plane Drops a Bounty Of Fur Pelts on Coast

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 -- President Eisenhower will make a goodwill trip soon to four South American countries, probably in late February and early March, informed diplomatic sources said today.
